titleStmt.title: William Vinson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5978

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisa Ky, October
Novr 5th 1864
To his Excellency
Thomas E, Bramlet,
Governor,,

Some five years ago one Gabriel Endicott, was convicted in the Lawrence Court for manslaughter, in killing David Justice, who, was my Brotherinlaw, I took the lead in employing counsel to assist in prosecuting said Endicott, we employed Col, L. T. Moore, Honl. L, W, Andrews and others; -- the case being as strangely made by proof as could be produced, left it only a case of circumstantial evidence; taking all things into consideration I am satisfied, the ends of
Justice; and cause of humanity, would be better, attained by pardoning Endicott, than keeping, him longer, confined to obtain this end, I have united, in a petition, of my neighbours, and have no doubt the entire, population of the county, would if applied to unite, in the prayer for his pardon; I am sir very respectfully your
